thread.title: A gorgeous final 2023 weekend in Houston
thread.title_full: A gorgeous final 2023 weekend in Houston

author: Daji Aswad
title: A gorgeous final 2023 weekend in Houston
text:
Saturday’s Forecast: Saturday morning temperatures chillier north of Houston below the freezing mark in places like Conroe. Houston waking up to temperatures in the mid and upper 30s. We say goodbye to the chill by the afternoon with a more southerly wind and sunshine that will help push temperatures into the low 60s and mid 60s.
Temperatures fell below freezing north of Houston leaving some areas with a light freeze and frost. (Copyright 2023 by KPRC Click2Houston - All rights reserved.) New Year’s Eve Forecast: Staying dry Sunday with temperatures climbing above average into the 70s. Sunday night no worries if you are headed out to any firework shows, we’re staying dry with a slight increase in clouds. Rain doesn’t return to the forecast until Monday along a cold front that could develop a few showers.
Temperatures rise above average for the last day of 2023. (Copyright 2021 by KPRC Click2Houston - All rights reserved.) Dry end to 2023. (Copyright 2021 by KPRC Click2Houston - All rights reserved.) We could start the new year with light rain early Monday morning (Copyright 2023 by KPRC Click2Houston - All rights reserved.) 10-Day forecast: The start of 2024 is cool and possibly rainy. The warmest temperatre I see is Monday and Friday at 62° with mornings in the 40s.
Sunny and warm end to 2023 (Copyright 2021 by KPRC Click2Houston - All rights reserved.) KPRC 2's Frank Billingsley has a passion for all things weather. Sent every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
